official-title.#text: To amend section 13 of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956, known as the Volcker Rule, to exclude certain debt securities of collateralized loan obligations from the prohibition against acquiring or retaining an ownership interest in a hedge fund or private equity fund.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives April 29, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Restoring Proven Financing for American Employers Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Restoring Proven Financing for American Employers Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following new paragraphs:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 13(g) of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956

header.#text: Rules of construction relating to collateralized loan obligations

text.#text: Nothing in this section shall be construed to require the divestiture, prior to July 21, 2017, of any debt securities of collateralized loan obligations, if such debt securities were issued before January 31, 2014.

header.#text: Inapplicability to certain collateralized loan obligations

text.#text: A banking entity shall not be considered to have an ownership interest in a collateralized loan obligation because it acquires, has acquired, or retains a debt security in such collateralized loan obligation if the debt security has no indicia of ownership other than the right of the banking entity to participate in the removal for cause, or in the selection of a replacement after removal for cause or resignation, of an investment manager or investment adviser of the collateralized loan obligation.

header.#text: Ownership interest with respect to collateralized loan obligations

term.#tail: means any issuing entity of an asset-backed security, as defined in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , that is comprised primarily of commercial loans.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 3(a)(77) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934

text.#text: a breach of a material term of the applicable management or advisory agreement or the agreement governing the collateralized loan obligation;
the inability of the investment manager or investment adviser to continue to perform its obligations under any such agreement;

any other action or inaction by the investment manager or investment adviser that has or could reasonably be expected to have a materially adverse effect on the collateralized loan obligation, if the investment manager or investment adviser fails to cure or take reasonable steps to cure such effect within a reasonable time; or
a comparable event or circumstance that threatens, or could reasonably be expected to threaten, the interests of holders of the debt securities.

term.#tail: if the investment manager or investment adviser is removed as a result of—

text.#text: An investment manager or investment adviser shall be deemed to be removed

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 4167 EH: Restoring Proven Financing for American Employers Act
